replies.msg:
For everyday conversation, just talk to people naturally and confidently. Native speakers usually speak very simple English, like: "it", "this", "that". Sometimes, it's not hurt to ask people politely, "I'm sorry. Can you say it again?". "I beg your pardon?"
For writing simple sentences, the automatic spelling and grammar checking functions that comes with the computer web browser and word processor can help you to write correct sentences. It will be more complicated to write outstanding things. It take some time to read more books (fiction or non-fiction), newspaper and articles on the internet in order to build up your writing style and vocabulary.

Watch english dramas and repeat every dialogue in your mind.
Subconsciously you are gonna pick up grammar and phrases that are widely used by the native speakers.

did you have foreigner friends?

if yes, you can try to speak with them any topic.

Absolutely! I’ve tried to talk to many foreign friends
But I want to make some improvements on vocabulary bank -this is the most important thing

Try reading newspaper on a daily basis and make it a habit(not tabloids)
Jot down all the words that you don’t understand
Review your notes every few days
Do it everyday for a month and I am pretty sure there will at least be some improvements

quote.msg: For what purpose? Business presentation?
General conversation and slightly for writing purposes

For everyday conversation, just talk to people naturally and confidently. Native speakers usually speak very simple English, like: "it", "this", "that". Sometimes, it's not hurt to ask people politely, "I'm sorry. Can you say it again?". "I beg your pardon?"
For writing simple sentences, the automatic spelling and grammar checking functions that comes with the computer web browser and word processor can help you to write correct sentences. It will be more complicated to write outstanding things. It take some time to read more books (fiction or non-fiction), newspaper and articles on the internet in order to build up your writing style and vocabulary.
